thread.title: Veronica and Franklin Biggins selling ‘one of Ansley Park’s oldest homes’ for $1.6 million (SLIDESHOW)
thread.title_full: Veronica and Franklin Biggins selling ‘one of Ansley Park’s oldest homes’ for $1.6 million (SLIDESHOW)

author: Phil W. Hudson
title: Veronica and Franklin Biggins selling ‘one of Ansley Park’s oldest homes’ for $1.6 million (SLIDESHOW)
text: 35 photos An Ansley Park home that was built in 1905 is on the market for $1.6 million. The 4,356 square-foot home at 138 Peachtree Circle is one of the oldest homes in Ansley Park. It has four bedrooms, three full-baths and one half-bath, and features 12-foot ceilings, seven working fireplaces, a pool, a finished terrace level, leaded glass windows pocket doors, according to its listing. 35 photos According to property records, the home is owned by The Franklin N. Biggins Revocable Trust. Franklin Biggins is an Atlanta attorney and former judge in the Magistrate Court of Fulton County. His wife, Veronica Biggins , is the managing partner of the Atlanta office of Philadelphia-based Diversified Search and previously was Assistant to the President of the United States and Director of Presidential Personnel under President Bill Clinton. In addition to her work with Diversified Search, she serves on board of directors for Phoenix-based Avnet Inc. and Dallas-based Southwest Airlines (NYSE: LUV). Listing agent Jason Cook of Dorsey Alston , Realtors said the renovations over the years have been in keeping with the original character and quality of the design. “The home is very appealing to people who like classic architecture but with modern conveniences,” he said. “It is rare to find this much charm in a newer construction home.” Cook noted one of the previous owners discovered a bookshelf that turns inward and leads to a secret room in the basement. “It is like something you would find in a movie," he said.
